stories.title: Smart-Crop – removes repetitive blank and insignificant areas from screenshots
The single best interview question you can ask

stories.text:
Hey guys,

I've been working on a Rust-like programming language written in Rust. I've worked on this compiler for the past months, and it's coming along very well.

The language features closures, higher-order function support, recursion, among other interesting things.

Here's the GitHub link, take a look!: https://github.com/geckolang/gecko

Also, come hang out on the official Discord server, I'm very interested on the compiler-design topic and can help you out if you have any questions about the project or designing your own compiler!

https://discord.gg/H3eMUXp
stories.title: Statically-typed, Rust-like programming language
What BlockFi’s $100M settlement with the SEC means for future of DeFi lending
Deep introduction to class decorators in TypeScript
When the developers constantly choose quick solutions over right solutions

stories.text:
I'm curious as to how Google Drive and Dropbox work under the hood but I couldn't find any information. Anybody in HN has some insight of what version control system or architecture they use? Do they make use of any of the industry VCSs?

(I've been researching version control systems for quite a while and this has been a long burning curiosity of mine)
stories.title: Ask HN: What versioning system do GDrive/Dropbox use?
